document_data.name: Desert Wraith
document_data.mainbody: '''Desert wraiths''' were a rare form of malevolent, [[undead]] spirits that arose from the bodies of those killed by a [[skriaxit]].
document_data.Description: These spirits had two forms. That of their previous self, typically a [[human]], and that of a [[jackal]]. They were capable of shifting between these two forms as they saw fit.
document_data.Behavior: Desert wraiths were wholly evil creatures, whose only motivation in un-life was to destroy any living creature they came across. Their intelligence was rather low, but they were capable of cunning.
document_data.Abilities:
These spirits could see in total darkness as if they were in noon and much like the average [[wraith]] their touch drained life energy from living creatures. Unless washed in [[holy water]], those killed by them would rise within forty-eight hours as a [[zombie]].

Desert wraiths could be [[turn undead|turned]], similarly to [[spectre]]s. They could be harmed by weapons with a ''[[item enchantment|+1 or greater enchantment]]''. If exposed to sunlight they would perish.
document_data.Combat: Desert wraiths would either hide themselves within the [[sand]] and surprise their prey or charge at them in their jackal form and then attack in their human form once close enough.

Ecology.Diet: Desert wraiths fed off the life energy of living creatures.
Ecology.Habitats: Desert wraiths were found wherever skriaxits could be found, which were typically subtropical deserts, such as the [[Great Vale]] in [[Mulhorand]]. They only roamed the desert at night, retreating to barrows they dug within the sand to hide from [[the sun]].
